views.markdown:
Compatible with iOS 9 and 10

TouchBar brings the macOS style TouchBar found on the MacBook Pros. Adapted for iOS it provides a function bar at the bottom of the screen.

By default the Home bar is displayed. A back, home and multitasking button.

Swiping left on the TouchBar by default displays the control bar. A series of controls for device functions such as brightness and volume.

Swiping left from the is a music section you can skip, rewind and toggle pause from that section.

TouchBar is highly customisable and can be modified via the preferences page.

Currently Not compatible with Harbour, Cercube, StopAlarm8+. Tweaks cause a respring loop.

Bug fixes and improvements Added support for harbour by disabling TouchBar on homescreen due to Dock interactions.

Fixed Dock and App grids getting close.

Fixed back button not responding, please allow for time for the animation between switching applications to complete.

Added TouchBar in app switcher, why wasn't it there in the first place?

Other small bug fixes and speed improvements.

Added AppList as a dependency.
